definition[0]: to make someone do what you want by illegally offering them money or threatening them
example[0]: The jury had been nobbled and the case had to be reheard.
definition[1]: to prevent a horse from winning a race, especially by giving it drugs
definition[2]: to get someone’s attention, especially in order to persuade them to do something
example[1]: I was nobbled by my deaf old aunt and couldn’t get away.
